feed.title: RSSOwl - A Java RSS / RDF / Atom Newsreader - May the owl be with you

entry.title: Back from JAX
entry.content:
It was a very exciting week in Wiesbaden with a lot of cool Sessions and Workshops. I took some pictures with my new camera, however most of the pictures really have a bad quality:
  • Exhibition Hall
  • Keynote
  • Eclipse Nite
  • JAX Party

Ben

entry.title: This Week @ JAX
entry.content:
This week I am attending the Java conference Jax in Wiesbaden. With the Eclipse Forum, a small EclipseCon is taking place here with some interesting talks and workshops. I am looking forward for this evenings Eclipse Night and will post some more news about what is happening here over the week.

Ben

entry.title: Linux RPMs are online
entry.content:
Thanks to Kay, the RPMs for RSSOwl 1.2.1 on Linux 32 and 64 Bit are now online as well and available from here.

Ben

entry.title: RSSOwl 1.2.1 released
entry.content:
The RSSOwl development team is happy to announce a fresh new version.
Check out some of the cool new features:
  • Drag and drop reordering for tabs
  • Open Feeds of a Folder in seperate tabs with one click
  • Improved Look and Feel
  • Favorites remember unread News even after a restart
  • Shipped as universal binary on Mac supporting both PPC and Intel
  • A lot of Bugfixes
Download for: Windows | Linux | Linux 64Bit | Mac | Solaris

May the owl be with you,
Ben

entry.title: Post to del.icio.us from RSSOwl
entry.content: There is an interesting tutorial on how to setup RSSOwl to easily post to del.icio.us using the "Blog News" command. Find it here. Ben

entry.title: Article on RSSOwl in german Java Magazin
entry.content:
I wrote an article about RSSOwl for the popular german Java Magazin. It was added to this months issue and the article is even featured on the front page.

More information is available here.

Ben

entry.title: RSSOwl on Mac Intel
entry.content: Now that Macs on Intel CPU are available, we plan to release upcoming RSSOwl 1.2.1 with universal binaries. So with that version all Mac users should be able to run RSSOwl both on Mac with Intel and PowerPC, using the same application bundle. Ben

entry.title: RSSOwl and Fedora Core 5
entry.content:
Thanks to Anthony Green, RSSOwl 1.2 is now part of Fedora Extras. Fedora Core is a linux distribution currently available as a test-version for the upcoming makjor release 5. Once FC 5 is out, I will post more details on how to obtain RSSOwl from Fedora Extras.

Ben

entry.title: False spyware warning on rssowl.exe *update*
entry.content:
Some users informed me about the fact that Kaspersky recently detects rssowl.exe as Hoax.Win32.SpyWare. This is of course wrong and I already informed them. If you receive the same virus warning from any other anti-virus product, please leave a comment.

Update: The issue is resolved!
Ben

entry.title: Mac version fixed and Linux RPMs released
entry.content:
Good news, the Mac version was updated and should no longer crash when managing favorites.

The RPMs for Linux 32 and 64 Bit are released today as well, thanks Kay!

Ben

entry.title: RSSOwl 1.2 released
entry.content:
The RSSOwl development team is happy to announce the next big step in RSSOwl's development.
Check out some of the cool new features:
  • Fully customizable Toolbar with new elements like 'History'
  • New Search Scopes allow for more detailed searches
  • Cool new look for the HTML Export of News
  • Quick-Filter added to Preferences Dialog to quickly find settings
  • Switch on 'Linked Mode' to update selection in your Favorites automatically
  • Improved Feed-Search and Feed-Discovery
  • Support for Atom 1.0 Format
  • A lot of Bugfixes
Download for: Windows | Linux | Linux 64Bit | Mac | Solaris

May the owl be with you,
Ben

entry.title: Illustration for Dutch computer magazine
entry.content:
Just received an awesome illustration Metin Seven has done for a dutch computer magazine:

Thanks for this cool Owl!
Ben

entry.title: Suggest feeds to be added to Samples in RSSOwl 1.2
entry.content:
Again it is your chance to suggest newsfeeds which are not yet part of the Samples in RSSOwl. Your suggestions will be added into the Samples list of upcoming RSSOwl 1.2.

Requirement: Interesting and active Feeds in English

Simply leave a comment with a URL or send it to me via mail.

Thanks.
Ben

entry.title: Help us finish translations for RSSOwl 1.2
entry.content:
We are still looking for people helping us finishing the existing translation by translating the terms that where added during development of 1.2 (~ 20 items).

Required Languages:
  • none
If you speak one of these, please contact me.
Thanks,
Ben

entry.title: Call for Tester *update*
entry.content:
We are looking for more people interested in testing RSSOwl preview-releases on Windows, Linux, Mac or Solaris.

If you are interested, contact me and I will invite you to the internal Tester-Mailing-List.

Update: Thanks for the big feedback I am getting! Of course all existing testers of previous versions will be informed about new preview-releases as well!
